author: Aimee Edwards
title: Spotify Supercharges Australian Advertising Offerings With Launch Of Spotify Ad Exchange
text:
Spotify has announced a major upgrade to its advertising offerings in Australia, introducing a new programmatic solution and a range of enhancements designed to streamline how advertisers buy, create, and measure campaigns on the platform.
At the heart of the update is the launch of Spotify Ad Exchange (SAX), a programmatic marketplace that allows advertisers to reach Spotifyâ€™s logged-in users through real-time auctions. The exchange supports full addressability and measurement capabilities, offering greater flexibility and transparency in media buying.
Following a successful pilot in the US, Canada, and Australia, SAX is now available to local advertisers through leading demand-side platforms (DSPs) such as The Trade Desk and Googleâ€™s Display & Video 360. The exchange provides access to Spotifyâ€™s full suite of audio, video, and display formats across music, with podcast inventory set to be added soon.
This move reflects the broader industry trend towards automation and outcome-based strategies. Spotifyâ€™s Head of Automation for JAPAC, Liam Hickey, emphasised the companyâ€™s commitment to supporting brands with omni-channel solutions that align with evolving media habits.
â€œThe advertising industry is rapidly shifting towards automation, with programmatic and self-serve platforms driving display and video ad spend. As Spotify continues to grow, weâ€™re helping brands embrace more outcomes-driven, omnichannel strategies,â€ Hickey said.
â€œThrough Spotify Ad Exchange, weâ€™re evolving our platform to make advertising more automated, competitively priced, and addressableâ€”putting outcome-based audio and the right formats at advertisersâ€™ fingertips. At launch, weâ€™re partnering with industry-leading DSPs like The Trade Desk and DV360, providing seamless access to high-quality inventory across music, with podcasts coming soon.â€
In parallel, Spotify is continuing to evolve its self-serve Ads Manager platform with improved targeting, enhanced measurement tools, and outcome-driven campaign objectives. New features include Spotify Pixel, Custom Audiences, expanded third-party integrations, and a dedicated App Install objective.
Spotify is also investing in creative services through its in-house consultancy, Spotify AUX, which helps brands connect with audiences through music, culture, and content production. The division works closely with artists and creators to deliver bespoke, culturally resonant campaigns.
Measurement remains a key focus, with the platform rolling out updated tools such as Spotify Brand Lift and new partnerships with DoubleVerify and Integral Ad Science (IAS). Additionally, Spotify is incorporating identity solutions like Unified ID 2.0, LiveRampâ€™s RampID, and Googleâ€™s PAIR for more robust campaign tracking and attribution.
These advancements come during a period of strong global momentum for Spotify. The platform has achieved its first full year of profitability, with total revenues growing 20 per cent year-over-year. Since 2020, Spotifyâ€™s advertising revenue has increased by 141 per cent, driven largely by brand campaigns.
With a global user base of 675 million across 184 marketsâ€”and more than 90 per cent of users considering the platform essential to their daily livesâ€”Spotify is positioning itself as a key player in the evolving digital advertising landscape. Internal data also shows that combining audio and video ads on Spotify can boost purchase intent by 27 per cent and generate a 66 per cent increase in incremental sales compared to audio-only campaigns.
The introduction of SAX and the expansion of its ad tech capabilities signal Spotifyâ€™s ongoing push to lead in the digital audio advertising space, offering brands the tools they need to drive measurable results at scale.

author: ElNacional.cat
title: On veure les Aurores Boreals aquest cap de setmana a Barcelona i Catalunya
text: Aquest cap de setmana, els cels de Catalunya i d'Espanya oferiran un espectacle bastant inusual: les aurores boreals. GrÃ cies a una intensa activitat solar, les aurores, normalment visibles a latituds molt mÃ©s altes, s'han pogut observar en els Ãºltims dies en diversos punts del territori catalÃ . La recent activitat geomagnÃ¨tica s'ha intensificat, permetent que aquest fenomen tan poc comÃº es manifesti en zones mÃ©s meridionals com Catalunya. Vols saber com gaudir de les aurores boreals en els prÃ²xims dies? Segueix llegint! âœ¨ [Les aurores boreals tenyeixen el cel de Catalunya: les imatges mÃ©s espectaculars](https://www.elnacional.cat/ca/societat/aurores-boreals-tenyeixen-cel-catalunya-imatges-mes-espectaculars_1297978_102.html) Per quÃ¨ es veuen les aurores boreals a Catalunya? Normalment, les aurores boreals sÃ³n visibles en regions polars, com Noruega o IslÃ ndia, perÃ² en aquest cas, lâ€™augment de l'activitat solar ha llanÃ§at grans quantitats de partÃ­cules carregades cap a la Terra. Aquestes partÃ­cules, en interactuar amb el camp magnÃ¨tic terrestre, generen les aurores. La previsiÃ³ per aquest cap de setmana indica que hi haurÃ  condicions propÃ­cies per veure-les grÃ cies a la persistÃ¨ncia d'una tempesta geomagnÃ¨tica, que ja ha deixat rastre d'aurores els dies anteriors a tant a Catalunya com a la resta del mÃ³n, amb cels tenyits de tons rosats, verds i violetes. UPDATE! CME passage intensified; things are favorable for G4 levels to potentially continue into night hours. Keep space weather aware atâ€” NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (@NWSSWPC) [https://t.co/YLUbTRM02y]for the latest. We take actions to notify officials and critical infrastructure operators, so you can enjoy the aurora [pic.twitter.com/uvZ7Ju0ps8] [October 10, 2024] Millors llocs per veure les aurores boreals a Catalunya Per gaudir al mÃ xim de les aurores boreals, Ã©s fonamental buscar llocs amb poca contaminaciÃ³ lumÃ­nica i cels clars. A Barcelona, les ubicacions elevades com MontjuÃ¯c, Torre BarÃ³ o el TurÃ³ de la Magarola sÃ³n opcions excelÂ·lents. Aquests llocs ofereixen miradors amb vistes Ã mplies i poc afectats per la ilÂ·luminaciÃ³ urbana. Fora de l'Ã rea metropolitana, els observatoris astronÃ²mics sÃ³n punts de referÃ¨ncia per l'observaciÃ³ d'aquest fenomen. L'Observatori de Pujalt, situat a l'Anoia, i el Parc AstronÃ²mic de Prades sÃ³n destinacions recomanades per la seva ubicaciÃ³ lluny de fonts de contaminaciÃ³ lumÃ­nica. Si cap d'aquests llocs et queda a prop, tambÃ© pots provar sort pujant a una muntanya propera de nit, on la latitud sigui elevada i el cel no tingui gaire contaminaciÃ³ lumÃ­nica. Consells per observar les aurores boreals - Evita la contaminaciÃ³ lumÃ­nica: Allunya't de les ciutats i busca zones amb cels foscos. - Ves a llocs elevats: Els punts alts faciliten una millor visiÃ³ de l'horitzÃ³. - Consulta la previsiÃ³ meteorolÃ²gica: Els cels clars sÃ³n imprescindibles per veure les aurores boreals, per tant, et recomanem consultar la previsiÃ³ del temps abans de fer cap desplaÃ§ament. - Sigues pacient i abriga't bÃ©: Recorda que podries tardar bastant temps en veure les aurores i, a mÃ©s a mÃ©s, la temperatura nocturna pot ser freda, especialment a les zones de muntanya. Aurores per tot el mÃ³n Les xarxes s'han inundat amb fotos d'usuaris que han pogut gaudir de les aurores boreals a tot arreu del mÃ³n. A la resta d'Espanya, les aurores s'han pogut veure des de multitud de llocs diferents, deixant veure una imatge de postal increÃ¯ble i completament inusual. Los pilares de la aurora boreal bailando encima de San Juan de Gaztelugatxe.â€” David de la Iglesia ðŸ“· (@DIVCreativo) [pic.twitter.com/S8Wifk8UxI] [October 11, 2024] TambÃ© s'han pogut veure, per exemple, al desert de Sonora, a MÃ¨xic. Aquest fet ha deixat una bonica imatge que contrasta amb el paisatge del desert. Aurora boreal en el desierto de Sonora, MÃ©xico. 10/Oct/2024â€” Gerardo L Gerardo-Fotografia (@GGerardox2) Tormenta GeomagnÃ©tica. [pic.twitter.com/yfQn0fh1hn] [October 11, 2024] Tant si ets un apassionat de lâ€™astronomia com si nomÃ©s vols viure una experiÃ¨ncia diferent, aquest cap de setmana Ã©s el moment perfecte per contemplar els cels de Catalunya i deixar-te meravellar per la natura! [ElNacional.cat a WhatsApp](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VaCpAjh0gcfJ0q12kP15), hi trobarÃ s tota l'actualitat, en un clic!

author: Patrick Freiwah
title: VW kehrt Elektroauto-Namenskonzept den RÃ¼cken: ID-Modelle ohne Zukunft
text:
VW kehrt Elektroauto-Namenskonzept den RÃ¼cken: ID-Modelle ohne Zukunft
Volkswagen verzÃ¼ckt die Belegschaft mit einem Strategiewechsel bei den Elektroautos. Die MaÃŸnahme kÃ¶nnte E-MobilitÃ¤t in Deutschland einen weiteren Schub geben.
Wolfsburg/MÃ¼nchen â€“ Im Automobilbereich ist ein Name mehr als nur ein Etikett â€“ er ist auch ein StÃ¼ck Geschichte. Volkswagen setzt demnÃ¤chst auf die Kraft der Tradition und verabschiedet sich offenbar von der aktuellen Modellbezeichnung fÃ¼r Elektroautos.
Der Konzern hat einem Bericht zufolge auf einer Betriebsversammlung im Stammwerk Wolfsburg eine bedeutende Ã„nderung angekÃ¼ndigt: E-Autos der nÃ¤chsten Generation werden kÃ¼nftig nicht mehr nach dem bisherigen Muster benannt.
VW mit neuer E-Auto-Strategie: Modellnamen mit traditionellen Wurzeln
VW-Markenchef Thomas SchÃ¤fer erklÃ¤rte laut der Wolfsburger Allgemeinen, dass â€žikonische Namenâ€œ nicht sterben dÃ¼rfen und der ID-Name fÃ¼r neue Modelle auslÃ¤uft.
Die Entscheidung wÃ¼rde das Ende einer Ã„ra markieren, die unter dem frÃ¼heren Vorstandschef Herbert Diess (bis 2022 im Amt) begann. Damals wurde mit dem ID.3 das Pendant zum klassischen Golf als erstes Modell einer eigenen Elektro-Familie vorgestellt.
Die ID-Buchstaben standen laut einer 2019 verÃ¶ffentlichten Pressemitteilung fÃ¼r â€žintelligentes Designâ€œ und â€žIdentitÃ¤tâ€œ â€“ und sollten die neuen Stromer mit visionÃ¤ren Technologien klar von den Verbrennermodellen abgrenzen. Dass sich diesbezÃ¼glich eine Ã„nderung anbahnt, berichtete Ippen.Media vor einigen Monaten.
Volkswagen Ã¤ndert E-Auto-Namen: Was bedeutet das fÃ¼r aktuelle Modelle?
Dass bereits die bestehenden Modellnamen der elektrischen Fahrzeuge aus Wolfsburg angepasst werden, wÃ¤re ein ungewÃ¶hnlicher Schritt. Eine entsprechende Anfrage der Autobild dazu blieb von Volkswagen unbeantwortet.
Vor wenigen Jahren lÃ¤utete die ID-Familie bei Volkswagen eine neue Ã„ra ein. Doch weder die Verkaufszahlen noch die Akzeptanz der Modelle konnten gÃ¤nzlich Ã¼berzeugen. Die RÃ¼ckbesinnung auf klassische Namen wie Golf, Polo und Tiguan kÃ¶nnte den Elektroautos von VW einen vertrauteren Anstrich geben â€“ und bei der Belegschaft im Stammwerk sei die AnkÃ¼ndigung gut angekommen, schildert der Bericht.
VW kehrt bei Modellnamen fÃ¼r Elektroautos zu den Wurzeln zurÃ¼ck
Viele Kundinnen und Kunden identifizieren sich stÃ¤rker mit den altbekannten Modellnamen: Ein Golf bleibt eben ein Golf â€“ auch wenn er elektrisch fÃ¤hrt und die Bezeichnung ID.3 trÃ¤gt. Die RÃ¼ckkehr zu traditionellen Bezeichnungen kÃ¶nnte daher nicht nur das Markenimage stÃ¤rken, sondern auch die Nachfrage nach Elektroautos ankurbeln. Gleiches gilt fÃ¼r geplante Ã„nderungen beim Design.
Mit dem neuen Elektro-Kleinwagen, der in wenigen Monaten startet, will VW laut der Wolfsburger Allgemeinen bereits auf die neue Namensgebung setzen. Anstatt ID.2 kÃ¶nnte das neue Einstiegsmodell als VW E-Polo oder womÃ¶glich ID.Polo an den Start gehen. Derweil erweisen sich in Deutschland produzierte E-Modelle zunehmend als Exportschlager. (PF)

title: Amanda Miguel aÃºn padece la pÃ©rdida de Diego Verdaguer, pero su familia y la mÃºsica ayudan
text:
Guadalajara â€” A dos aÃ±os y siete meses de la partida de su amado Diego Verdaguer , la tambiÃ©n cantante Amanda Miguel sigue procesando el duelo, aunque la compaÃ±Ã­a de su familia, su hija Ana Victoria, su nieto Luca, de casi tres aÃ±os y su hermanita que viene en camino, ha sido el mejor aliciente para lidiar con ello. Lea tambiÃ©n: La historia de Amanda Miguel y Chucho, el niÃ±o viral que cantarÃ¡ con ella
Advertisement La mÃºsica es, al mismo tiempo, uno de sus principales motores, a falta de quien fuera su compaÃ±ero de vida por 48 aÃ±os. Por ello, el mÃ¡s reciente disco de Amanda Miguel, Yo Soy , lo hizo con cariÃ±o especial.
Advertisement â€œSigue siendo difÃ­cil su ausencia, porque nunca me imaginÃ© quedarme sin Ã©l, pero la vida pone sus condiciones, sus reglas y uno no tiene ni a quiÃ©n ni por quÃ© reclamar, uno viene solo y se va solo. Me hubiera gustado irme con Ã©l, como me decÃ­a, â€˜el dÃ­a que nos toque, nos vamos juntosâ€™, y nos reÃ­amos. Desde siempre supimos que Ã©ramos amores de otras vidas y asÃ­ esâ€, asegurÃ³ la cantante nacida en argentina.

author: VNExplorer
title: Visiting Sudzha, Russian Kursk border town held by Ukraine
text: DW correspondent Nick Connolly was embedded with Ukraine's military on a brief trip to the Russian border town of Sudzha in Kursk currently held by Ukraine. Locals said they were without power, water and phone signals. The Russian town of Sudzha, in the far south of the Kursk region, and just across the border from the Ukrainian town of Sumy, has been under Kyiv's control for roughly a week now and contested for roughly two. Ukraine's government on Thursday published images of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visiting the border region, close to where Ukrainian forces launched their surprise incursion into Russian territory. But Kyiv has also been allowing reporters to accompany its military forces for a brief glimpse of the town on the other side of the frontier, in controlled circumstances. DW's Ukraine-based correspondent Nick Connolly was among them. Little remains of what used to be the border checkpoint in Sudzha Ukraine military spokesman: 'We don't want to keep this land, we don't need it' Ukraine's government has said the surprise incursion into Russia, which Western allies like the US and Germany say they had no prior knowledge of, is a bid to create a "buffer zone," saying Russia has been launching aerial attacks on northeastern Ukraine from the south of Kursk. However, the area to the northwest of Kharkiv constitutes just a tiny fraction of Ukraine and Russia's shared border of almost 2,300 kilometers (more than 1,400 miles). So while holding this territory could make a difference for a Ukrainian border city like Sumy, its overall impact is liable to be marginal. Oleksiy Dmytrashkivskyi has been named spokesman of the newly-created Ukrainian Kursk region military command, and he told DW the operation was also meant to send a message to Russia that the conflict was not a one-way street. "We don't want to keep this land, we don't need it," Dmytrashkivskyi said. "We've had to do this to show our enemy that they're vulnerable too, that they're not all-powerful." Lenin statue toppled; power, water and cellphone service cut off Connolly reported that those civilians who were unable to flee in time have been without power, running water and mobile phone signal for around two weeks now, cut off from their families in the rest of Russia. His visit, overseen by Ukrainian soldiers, lasted just a few hours. He spoke with a few locals who were sat outside, close to a cellar where they spend the nights in a bid to stay safe. Otherwise, Connolly said, the streets were largely empty and dangerous, with unexploded grenades and other ordinance abundant underfoot, and for the most part just the hum of electricity generators (for those still able to produce their own power) audible. Some reporters were taken for a glimpse of Sudzha last week, soon after Ukraine claimed complete control of the town Those left behind often elderly, or caring for the elderly One woman who identified herself as Nina said she was never given a chance to evacuate, and that the people she knew who fled did so independently, in their cars. "I live alone. My daughter lives far away. I had no way of getting out. I was looking after an elderly friend, she was sick â€” I couldn't just leave her. She died yesterday and we buried her today," Nina said. Another woman said that the previous day, while she was sheltering in the cellar, her home had been destroyed, most likely by artillery fire from one side or the other. Oleg, a middle-aged man who said he is not from Sudzha but that he had come to the town with work on the day fighting erupted soon found himself trapped. "We didn't understand what was happening. I've been here ever since. My parents are back in the village, they're 84 and 83 years old. I don't know what's happened to them and they don't know what's happened to me," he said. Ukraine's military says its operations in Kursk also involve the destruction of key bridges and other infrastructure near its border Showing civilians Russian atrocities in Ukraine After Connolly had spoken to the locals, Ukrainian soldier Dmytrashkivskyi took out his laptop and began to show them a video from Bucha, the town near Kyiv where Russian troops are accused of carrying out war crimes during their initial, failed 2022 attempt to encircle and take the Ukrainian capital. He reported that the locals seemed exhausted and barely able to take anything in. Some Ukrainian soldiers told Connolly off camera they hoped that if they showed ordinary Russians what was done in their name in Ukraine, that might lead them to question President Vladimir Putin's story of what he refers to as a "special military operation" in Ukraine. Shortly after this, Ukrainian troops told Connolly it was time to leave and his short visit was brought to an end.

author: Avi Shravan
title: LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronny's siblings in matching red outfits
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Follow Us Share 0 Discuss 0 Discuss What's your opinion? LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronnyâ€™s siblings in matching red outfits Discuss Now LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronnyâ€™s siblings in matching red outfits. (Credits: IMAGN) LeBron James shared his family's Christmas celebrations with his 159 million followers on Instagram. The Lakers superstar posted pictures from the auspicious day on his handle.
He accompanied his thoughts and warm Christmas wishes in the caption of his upload.
"MERRY CHRISTMAS FROM THE JAMES GANG TO YOURS!!! ðŸ‘‘âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨ " â€¢
70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now Trending Explore the NBA Draft 2024 with our free NBA Mock Draft Simulator & be the GM of your favorite NBA team.
The post featured four pictures, all of which were the same but with slight differences. In the pictures, the James family - Savannah James, Bronny James , Bryce James and the youngest Zhuri James - wore similar clothes.
All five members wore red pajamas with miniature designs on them. King James and his wife stand behind their kids while Bronny stands to their right and Bryce stands to their left. Zhuri occupied the space in the middle and in front of her mother.
LeBron James delivered a spectacular performance against the Golden State Warriors on Wednesday. The Lakers played the Dubs in a Christmas Day game, with Bron and Steph Curry putting on a great show reminiscent of their performance in the 2016 NBA Finals. James scored a double-double, netting 31 points, four rebounds and 10 assists.
The Dubs put on a great fight, but Austin Reaves 's last-minute game-winner sealed the win for the LA side. The Lakers won the matchup with a final score of 115-113.
LeBron James calls out NFL during post-game interview on Christmas Day After the 115-113 win against the Warriors on Christmas Day at the Chase Center, LeBron James gave a post-game interview in which he called out the NFL. The NFL was also running high-profile matches in the same time slots as the NBA, resulting in a split in viewership. However, after a spectacular performance, King James proclaimed that Christmas Day belongs to the NBA.
"I love the NFL but Christmas is our day," James said. (1:28) King James also praised the Warriors star Steph Curry and talked about the great performances they have been delivering together over the years.
"Today is a day of giving and me and that's what me and Steph continue to do and try to do for our fans, for our beautiful game so yeah big shout out to AR (Austin Reaves) though, that was big time," James said. The LA Lakers are having a good run under JJ Redick, their new coach. They have a 17-13 record and are in the sixth spot in the Western Conference standings.

author: Adam Fullerton
title: Dallas Mavericks CEO on new arena: 'We're full speed ahead' | FOX 4 Dallas-Fort Worth
text:
Mavs rumored move to Irving | Who Cares!? FOX 4's Steven Dial joins Jeff Kolb and Ethan Herrera to talk about the politics behind the rumored move by the Dallas Mavericks to Irving.
The Brief Dallas Mavericks CEO Rick Welts spoke about the efforts to build a new arena for the team. The team's lease at the AAC comes to an end in 2031. Welts says the team is looking for options in Dallas before looking in other parts of the Metroplex. DALLAS - Dallas Mavericks CEO Rick Welts and general manager Nico Harrison answered questions from reporters on Tuesday.
While much of the meeting focused on the Luka DonÄiÄ‡ trade , Welts also spoke about the efforts to build a new arena.
There has been a great deal of speculation around the team's next location when the Mavs' lease at the American Airlines Center comes to an end in 2031.
READ MORE: Nico Harrison on Luka Doncic trade, Dirk Nowitzki and more: FULL TRANSCRIPT
Dallas Mavericks on new arena DALLAS, TEXAS - DECEMBER 19: Newly appointed Dallas Mavericks Chief Executive Officer Rick Welts looks on prior to the game against the LA Clippers at American Airlines Center on December 19, 2024 in Dallas, Texas. (Photo by Sam Hodde/Getty Images)
Expand Welts told reporters he believes the team's efforts to build a "new arena entertainment district" has been overshadowed by other turmoil among the team.
The CEO says the team has been in discussions with the city of Dallas to find a suitable 30 to 50 acres of land to build the arena.
A company connected to Las Vegas Sands, which is run by Mavericks governor Patrick Dumont, owns a plot of land in Irving. The Texas Stadium site has been widely considered to be a possible location for a new arena.
Welts said the team is looking for a solution in Dallas before looking other places in the Metroplex.
"I think the progress we've made to date makes me very encouraged that you know, ultimately, you know, we're going to find that location within the boundaries of the city of Dallas," he said.
Related
article Dallas Mavericks, Nico Harrison double down on Luka DonÄiÄ‡ trade to Lakers Dallas Mavericks General Manager Nico Harrison met with reporters for the first just the second time since orchestrating the deal to trade superstar Luka Doncic. He said stands by his unpopular decision and has no regrests.
The team's goal is to have the new arena open for the 2031-2032 season.
The arena would also host events like concerts.
Gambling legislation's impact on Dallas Mavericks' new arena Irving approves development without casino, nightclub In the early morning hours, the Irving City Council gave approval for Las Vegas Sands to move forward with a development but without a casino and nightclub. The move came after Sands removed its request for gaming in the 11th hour. FOX 4's Lori Brown reports on what's next.
The Mavericks' owners, the Adelson and Dumont families, have deep connections to the casino industry.
Las Vegas Sands has proposed a resort and casino attached to an arena in the past, but gambling appears unlikely to pass the Texas Legislature in the near future.
Welts says the plans for the arena will not depend on changes to the current laws.
"We're full speed ahead, with or without any legislation that permits casino gambling in Texas. So we're going to build absolutely the best facility for the Mavericks going forward. That's the focus, not dependent whatsoever on casino gambling in Texas," said Welts.
What does it mean for the Dallas Stars? DALLAS, TEXAS - MARCH 31: A general view of the American Airlines Center ahead of game between the NC State Wolfpack and the Duke Blue Devils in the Elite 8 round of the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament on March 31, 2024 in Dallas, Texas. (Photo by L
Expand Welts said the team will work with the Stars to improve the American Airlines Center for the time they remain in the building, but seemed to be intrigued by a basketball-only facility.
"There's some real advantages for basketball fans. If you design a basketball-only facility, you're not working around the larger geometry of a hockey rink versus a smaller floor footprint of a basketball court. So, at least at this point, we think the best option for the Mavericks right now, and for the experience of going to Mavericks games, would be to build a basketball-first facility," he said.
The Source: Information in this article comes from a private news conference held by the Dallas Mavericks on April 15, 2025.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->media and entertainment industry
